text: What is Chandler Bing's embarrassing and rarely-mentioned middle name on 'Friends'?

What James Cameron film was the highest-grossing movie of the 1990s and held the all-time box office record for 12 years?
In the thriller 'Se7en', what desperate question does Brad Pitt's character scream at the end of the film?
The line 'There's no crying in baseball!' comes from what 1992 film starring Tom Hanks as a cynical manager of a women's baseball team?
The 1995 teen comedy 'Clueless' is a modern retelling of what classic Jane Austen novel?
What was the first animated feature film to be nominated for a Best Picture Oscar?
Who composed the iconic, sweeping score for the 1993 film 'Jurassic Park'?
Nirvana's hit song 'Smells Like Teen Spirit' was unwittingly named after a brand of what product?
The 'grunge' music movement of the early 1990s is most associated with what U.S. city, home to bands like Nirvana, Pearl Jam, and Soundgarden?

What punk rock band released the massively successful album 'Dookie' in 1994?
What are the 'Spice' names of the five members of the Spice Girls?
correctAnswer: Scary, Sporty, Posh, Baby, and Ginger
acceptedAnswers: Scary, Sporty, Posh, Baby, and Ginger

text: Which member of the Spice Girls was not part of the group's original lineup?

What was the first rap song to hit No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100?
The intense 1990s hip-hop rivalry between the East and West coasts was primarily focused on which two rappers?
What famous three-word phrase would you hear from your computer after connecting to the internet via America Online (AOL) in the 90s?
What was the common name for the stock market bubble in the late 1990s, fueled by heavy investment in internet-based companies?
What Microsoft Office assistant, shaped like a piece of office stationery, was notorious for offering unsolicited help to users?
The search engine Google first debuted in 1998, but it was initially developed under what different, less appealing name?
What handheld digital pet from Japan became a massive fad in the 1990s, requiring owners to feed and care for it?
The widespread fear that computers would fail to handle the date change from 1999 to 2000 was known by what alphanumeric name?
What puzzle video game, famous for its falling blocks, was the first to be played by an astronaut in space?
What was the name of the first cloned sheep, born in 1996?
What stuffed animal collectibles with heart-shaped tags became a massive investment craze in the 1990s?
What was the first 'reality TV' show, which debuted on MTV in 1992 and featured a group of strangers living together?
What actor received a record-breaking $20 million for a single role in the 1996 film 'The Cable Guy'?
The character Steve Urkel, known for his catchphrase 'Did I do that?', was the nerdy neighbor on what 90s sitcom?
In 1992, then-presidential candidate Bill Clinton played what musical instrument on 'The Arsenio Hall Show'?
What video game character's iconic red shoes were inspired by the cover of Michael Jackson's album 'Bad'?
The 2004 documentary 'Super Size Me' chronicled 30 days of eating exclusively from which fast-food chain?
On the reality show 'Newlyweds', Jessica Simpson famously became confused about whether she was eating chicken or fish while eating what brand of tuna?
The best-selling book 'The Da Vinci Code' sparked widespread debate and a blockbuster movie in the 2000s. Who wrote the novel?
In 2002, Justin Timberlake and what pop superstar had a famous breakup, which was followed by Timberlake's release of the song 'Cry Me a River'?
What was the name of the life simulation video game series, created by Will Wright and first released in 2000, where players control virtual people?
E.L. James's erotic novel series 'Fifty Shades of Grey' originally started as fan fiction for what young adult book series?
What was the name of the first solo album Beyoncé released in 2003 after her time with Destiny's Child?

What 2000s rock anthem by The Killers starts with the lyric: 'Comin' out of my cage, and I've been doin' just fine'?
In 2003, who was the runner-up to Kelly Clarkson in the inaugural season of 'American Idol'?
The infamous 'wardrobe malfunction' during the Super Bowl XXXVIII halftime show involved Janet Jackson and what other performer?
What was the name of Apple's smallest iPod model, which was first released in 2005 and had no screen?
What reality TV show, which premiered in 2007, introduced the world to the Kardashian-Jenner family?
What socialite and reality TV star trademarked the catchphrase 'That's hot'?
What 2001 film won the first-ever Academy Award for Best Animated Feature?
In 2008, swimmer Michael Phelps won a record eight gold medals at the Olympic Games held in what city?
What 2008 film starring Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson launched a global vampire phenomenon?
Rihanna's 2007 mega-hit 'Umbrella' famously features a guest verse from what rapper?
The TV show 'Gossip Girl' was famously narrated by what actress, who voiced the titular blogger?
What line of sneakers featuring removable wheels in the heel became a popular fad in the 2000s?
In the 2004 film 'Anchorman', Will Ferrell's character Ron Burgundy says, 'Well, that escalated' what?
The internet prank of inserting a link to Rick Astley's 'Never Gonna Give You Up' music video is known by what name?

In a popular meme, a dog sits in a room engulfed in flames while calmly saying what three-word phrase?
What is the slang term for being an obsessive fan of a celebrity, derived from a 2000 Eminem song about a disturbed admirer?
What does the Gen Z slang term 'iykyk' stand for?

What does the acronym 'GOAT' stand for in pop culture and sports?
What term refers to the act of suddenly ending all communication with someone without explanation?
Besides Captain America, which other Avenger was shown to be able to lift Thor's hammer in the MCU films?

acceptedAnswers: Light one rope at both ends and the other at one end simultaneously
